featured.text: Kids are tuned into their parents’ eating preferences and are far more likely to try foods if they see their mother or father eating them.
The original budget for my round-island trip was NT$5,000, but the ______ cost is likely to be 50 percent higher.
According to certain documents, ancient Egyptians also used onions for medicinal purposes, but they likely would have viewed the 35 power of the vegetable as magical, rather than medical.
Where does this passage most likely appear?
If so, it is very likely that you have synesthesia.

other.text: Almost as soon as a child receives shoes to wear, he/she is likely to have grown out of them.
It can be inferred from the passage that a younger child is more likely to be a good __________.

According to the passage, where is Zanzibar most likely located on the following map? North America Europe Asia ○ A Atlantic Pacific Pacific Ocean ○ Ocean C Ocean Africa South ○ B Indian America Ocean ○ D (A) A (B) B (C) C (D) D 45.
According to the passage, what would a Charmer most likely do? (A) Stay away from people whenever possible.
What advice would Wesla most likely give other disabled people? (A) Ignore what you have lost and make the best use of what you have.
On the basis of the letter, is the most likely relationship between Sally and Tom? (A) Mother and son.
We had better not breastfeed our babies, since babies are most likely to be poisoned by dioxin.
Which of the following is most likely true about the poet? (A)
Who does “they” in the third paragraph most likely refer to? (A) Physicians.
What does the word “sedentary” in the third paragraph most likely mean? (A) Modern.
What does “the pieces of a blurred memory” in the third paragraph most likely refer to? (A)
Which word in the passage most likely means “to think about something seriously and carefully, especially before making an important decision”? 5.
What field of study does the research mentioned in the passage most likely belong to? (A) Psychology.
What does the phrase “in the balance” in the last paragraph most likely mean? (A) Being well taken care of.
However, this behavior is likely to make the interviewer feel very uncomfortable.
The additional tines made diners less likely to drop food, and the curved tines served as a scoop so people did not have to constantly switch to a spoon while eating.
According to the passage, what type of people are more likely to get well sooner when they get sick? 2.
(G) … is more likely to look young.
The sooner the test is conducted after the consumption of these drinks, the more likely a positive alcohol reading will be obtained. 49.
The researchers found that children who had cooked their own foods were more likely to eat those foods in the cafeteria than children who had not.
This passage is most likely taken from a(n) __________.
By contrast, later children are more likely to be more relaxed and sociable because their parents are more relaxed.
From which of the following is the passage likely to be taken? (A) A science magazine.
Used to caring for others, they are more likely to move toward such leadership professions as teaching and politics.
The longer the food stays in the mouth, the more likely cavities will develop.
A snake’s likelihood to drink also correlated with its body condition, with more withered snakes being more likely to drink, and to drink more.

By contrast, men are much more likely to interrupt (about three times as often in some studies), to argue about what has been said, to ignore or respond poorly to what has been said, to introduce more new topics into the conversation, and to make more assertions.
Which culture most likely created the sandals shown in the picture? (A) Indian. (B) Greek.
Researchers are not sure why some songs are more likely to get stuck in our heads than others, but everyone has their own tunes.

definition.en_def: Having a high probability of occurring or being true.
definition.example: It is likely to rain tomorrow.
